name: 相思
lyrics: 特別使用古調風格呈現的歌曲。
意境為思念感情初時的美好，令人懷念曾經相守甜蜜。
以古風表達情意初衷之時那悠然美好的憧憬，
堅守彼此約定，卻只能以思念曾經的美好情懷收場。
仰天長嘯，往事如煙，紅顏淚兩行，
如夢幻影，歲月無情，與君別斷腸。
相思愁，相思苦，相思亦是無盡時，
若緣盡，道別離，莫牽掛。
魂縈夢繫，
足踏青梅，倚虹窗，
挽君袖，赴月光，
冰月散華，
怨嘆時光 匆匆，
轉眼即逝獨自舞月光。
寒梅弄窗，枝頭嚮往，冰雪白蒼蒼，
兩兩相望，回眸一別，桑田已滄桑。
莫相思，莫牽掛，莫讓愁顏添紅妝，
綰青絲，盼雨聲，剪燭光。
魂縈夢繫，
足踏青梅，倚虹窗，
挽君袖，赴月光，
冰月散華，
怨嘆時光 匆匆，
轉眼即逝獨自舞月光。
Specially used songs presented in ancient tune style.
The artistic conception is to miss the beauty of the feelings at the beginning, which makes people miss the sweetness of the past.
The leisurely and beautiful longing when expressing affection in ancient style,

name: 我只是需要一個人
lyrics: 用粵語文字來呈現對於感情內心絕望的那種純粹無力感的張力，
搭配電吉他狂亂爬漲反覆著如同申訴斥喝著不公的嘶聲裂肺音階，
當你在聆聽的同時，
也狂亂了你的心。
(主歌)
寒冬中深深的抱擁, 癡心凝望,
只盼可以憾動心中癡夢....
寒風中感覺的溫度, 我心顫動,
此刻令我著迷心中 起 伏....啊～
(副歌)
我只是需要一個人,
可以明白我的真心,
在漫漫人海尋覓你背影.....
我只是需要一個人,
可以與我共渡一生,
喜歡你、靠近你、親吻你、擁抱你.
只想擁抱你！
〖 I Just Need One Guy〗

Use Cantonese text to show the tension of pure powerlessness in the despair of feelings, and sing: 'I just need someone who can understand my sincerity and look for your back in the endless crowds...'
With an electric guitar solo, a heartbreaking scale,
When you are listening,
Also frantic your heart.

name: 璿卿
lyrics: 蕉嶺長潭山歌/何利泉 唱
(長潭行出公王埤 一陣鯽魚一陣鯉
鯉嫲毋食叔叔釣 捏忒肚腸丟忒佢)
(獨白)
那暗埔聽客頭講
行私路兩三日就會到台灣
私路比官路快又省錢
庄肚个阿貴仔春分敬祖後也過去了
佢講「日仔實在難挨，恁仰个日仔哪有法度過下去呢？！」
共庄个後生條差毋多走淨淨仔
隔壁庄个後生仔也沒拵幾多
雖然聽講 那有得人畏个烏水溝
又有人講「六死三留一回頭」
又麼介 「過番剩一半，過台灣沒人轉」
驚麼介洨諾
就算路遠又危險
至少比囥在這鬼地方還好啊
亻厓 還後生 正十九歲
打拼正當時个時節
沒定著幾年後串大錢
恁樣轉老屋買田買地儘有面子啊
故所決定愛來賭佢一擺
從細到大 吂識去過恁遠个地方
也沒坐過 食海水个大船仔
屋家那塊田堵好賣忒做船費
毋使幾年串錢轉屋
再摎屋家人接過去台灣過好日仔
十九歲了
該當要做一隻大人氣相个男仔人
沒去就沒機會 去了 至少還有析把仔機會
拼就一條命定
黃璿卿 生1795年-卒1867年
西元1813年(時年19)由廣東省嘉應州岩背(今蕉嶺)渡海來臺，黃連煜為其第六代子孫
Jiaoling ChangTang Mountain Song by Li-Chun Ho
The lyrics of this mountain song use serval metaphors to convey two sides of life in the mountains
of Jiaolingcounty. When the lake of ChangTang's water is blown by the wind, gentle ripples are created on
the lake's surface, goldfish and carps swim with ease. The latter two sentences use fishing as a metonymy
for young men and women as they flirt and court each other.
(Monologue)
Trafficker said the other night
The trip to Taiwan takes merely two to three nights
Smuggling is cheaper and faster than traveling on record
A-Gui also left the village for Taiwan by boat after praying to his ancestors in mid-spring
He said, 'The days here are getting worse!
How can I continue to live like this?'
Most of the youth of my village have left
With few young people remaining in the surrounding settlements
Though I have heard of the treacherous Black Ditch
And people exclaiming, 'Six perish, three stay, and one returns.'
'Those that travel abroad, half usually survive and return home. But those that
venture to Taiwan, none to be ever seen or heard'
What have I to fear?
Even if the journey is long and arduous
Anything is better than just scraping by here
I am young, merely 19 years of age
It should be my time to take chances
Maybe in a few years I will make it big
Return to my village with my pockets lined and all the land to buy
I am going to roll a dice with my life
Never have I traveled such a distance
Nor have I ever taken an ocean vessel
My family's land should just about cover my travel fees
It shouldn't take me a few years to earn enough
So that I can also move my family to Taiwan
19 years of age I am
It is time to be a man
If I don't go, I will never know if there is a better life to be told
Nothing to fear for but my life
Note:
Xuan-Qing Huang
Born 1795, Death 1867
Xuan-Qing left his home in Jiaoling, Guangdong province at the age of 19 to pursue a better life in
Taiwan. Ayugo Huang is his sixth generation direct descendent.

There is an inaccessible thing in my heart
A dangerous land with no way to leave across the ocean
Though it may be a land of ghosts, still need to go to that Mountain of Doom
What is the sea? Something I have never seen
Seek a new life, leaving these lands of malaise
Though it may be a land of ghosts, still need to go to that Mountain of Doom
II: My fellow man, travel not to Taiwan
Taiwan, knock-on death's door
For a thousand have gone, and none have returned :II
Sell the farm and land to pay the smugglers and boat fees
If you don't go you will never know, life and death are on your own
Though it may be a land of ghosts, still need to go to that Mountain of Doom
Laying in agony, adrift on a sea of despair
Double or quits, life is a gambler's game
Though it may be a land of ghosts, still need to go to that Mountain of Doom
II: My fellow man, travel not to Taiwan
Taiwan, knock-on death's door
For a thousand have gone, and none have returned :II
II: Shivering seas and howling winds of the daunting Black Ditch
Gales and waves add to uncertainty, must go I must, must I go the Mountain of Doom

Get up early to hit the mountain road
With my water bottle, towel, and new bamboo stick
Out of breath, the summit is near
A sudden snake of big size comes into sight
Frightened for my safety, I jolted fast
Bamboo stick held ready to attack
Who knew the beast would slide by my feet
Also frightened for its life into a cave it went
With heavy heart I eventually made it to the mountain's peak
Wisdom has it, 'Once bitten, twice shy.'
Quick to descend the mountain I would try to reach
With lingering fears of encountering another venomous beast
My head was swirling, and my sight was hazy
Just when I saw that eagle on the tree with majesty
Never had I seen a bird its size in close proximity
And immediately forgot my fear of the slithery hostility
Why, snake in my mind
Who tell me why, eagle made it resigned
Pray and recite Amitabha
How swell the big snake is dispelled by an eagle
Note:This song is sung in Hakka and animal speak

name: 茶園食茶香對香

At the summit of Bagua Mountain in the morning light

Fire is reaching toward the broad plains of the south
After traveling beyond 400 miles on the red clay mounds I will take a rest

So fertile and abound
These fields of the dry land will never

Hsien-Mei, never say that I don't wanna go home

The harvest this year
Will need to be done by you women

To let the sun dry out the sliced white radish, and store the rice in the barn
Hsien-Mei, I know that death is near
Seasonal scent of white radish and rice that you have reaped, will lead my spirit back to our village
of Tongluo
Note: The Japanese invasion of Taiwan in 1895 was a conflict involving Formosan insurrectionists, after the

Chinese Qing Empire's cession of the Island to the Japanese Empire as part of reparations of the First Sino-Japanese War. The leader Republic of Formosa, Tang-Sin Wu, fought the Japanese from the Taoyuan
plateau to Bagua Mountain, which coincide with the only area where red clay earth can be found in Taiwan.
By the time Wu and his men had reached Bagua Mountain, the majority of Formosan forces had been lost.
The Japanese would continue their conquest of Taiwan in a two-pronged approach that covered both
seaside and mountain settlements. Hakka forces Pingtung held out against the invaders in modern-
day Changzhi Township. Once they were defeated, the locals began to refer to the area of this battle as the
'Burning Village.'
Hsien-Mei Huang was the wife of Tang-Sin Wu.

name: 快轉，倒帶
lyrics: 不知不覺間只剩下一個人。夥伴們都離開了。
高架橋下那個小夥子 跨坐在小綿羊機車上專心玩著手機，
他的實際年齡應該比我還年輕個二十幾歲吧。
念國中那時，CD與隨身聽剛出現，
還幻想著未來說不定耳機就能聽音樂，結果真的實現了。
那陣子瘋狂迷戀一個樂團，光是在洗完澡後沾滿水蒸氣的鏡面上
寫下樂團的名字就興奮得無法自己。
相隔三十年重聽那個樂團的專輯。在台北，深夜的，街上，橋上與上弦月，雷鳴在鐵皮屋頂上跳舞的雨點一起聽。
台灣的夜晚，我大聲唱，回頭看，十四歲的我也在唱。
光を集めて　誘う　七色の風
光を集めて　運ぶ　七色の夢
十五歲開始彈吉他。因為吉他我遇見了許多人。
似乎較偏愛金屬搖滾的台灣吉他手，最近也帥氣地彈奏出更豐富多彩的音樂了。
小學一，二年紀時，為了在畢業典禮還是什麼場合向高年級獻上一曲，
大家唱了當時的流行歌。不帶一絲個性，只是純粹將熱量灌注在語言和旋律中。
從會彈吉他開始我是否像這樣把能量灌注在音樂中呢？如果有，那又是什麼時候。
我一直想不起來，那種透明的感覺。
台灣的夜晚，我大聲唱，回頭看，七歲的我一臉微笑。
自從彈了吉他，靠音樂謀生以來，我一直將他們拋在腦後而現在我們重逢了。
抱歉讓你們久等了。我這麼想。謝謝你們，我這麼想。
此後我將帶著七歲和十四歲的自己，一起走下去。
在這變幻莫測的現實世界中，
從那時起，乃至現在，我始終活在夢裡。
我會不停迴轉，也會繼續捲動。
快轉，倒帶。

name: 遊覽指南
lyrics: 歡迎來到水族館。本館將在今日開放時間結束後進入永久性閉館。
為方便您快速、有序入館，請將仿生機械軀幹或器官的內置晶片調整至外部識別許可模式，依次排隊，一人一碼；多生命嵌合體請出示所有意識體的識別碼。請您配合防疫工作，按照規定做好呼吸器官的防護，不要接受不明來源的埠接入請求，以免發生病毒感染。
參觀過程中，為了您的安全，請按照指定路線行進，不要大聲喧嘩或嘗試與展品直接交互。如果您因違規而發生意外共鳴，本館概不負責。
展覽區域內禁止飲食，用餐請至C區館內餐廳。
遊覽完成後，您可以搭乘13號磁懸浮列車返回市內。
您的遊覽全程將被記錄下來，成為本館最後的藏品。祝您擁有一段藍色的美好回憶，我們將永遠銘記您的光臨。

name: 路
lyrics: (這是我自己的路 我卻走得非常馬虎 放下過去 世人唾棄)
這是一場悲劇 雪藏後的聲音 空白的夢想被當初那一巴掌打醒

放下過去，這是你自己的路，越來越看不清楚
